content.description: This route starts up the West face directly under the window (the obvious hole in the rock).  Climb up some good cracks (5.8) with a couple tricky moves and lots of jamming to the window.  From here, jam out the overhang on good hands that quickly turn to tight bastard hands in the dihedral (5.10+).  Follow this until you get to the bolt ladder protecting the chimney.  You now must climb the weirdest thing in the world (5.10+ squeeze) - you will be horribly confused, but it's some of the best climbing in the desert.  A couple unroped mantels on the summit (avoid the chipped edges on the first one for extra style points) lead to the top, and a gazillion new bolts (?).  One of the best towers in the desert.  Two double-rope raps get you down.
content.protection: Bring a standard rack with a few extra #1 Camalots.
